items.description: The first item in the list, 'performance', refers to the quality, efficiency, and effectiveness of the individual's work and output, as assessed by the Employer.
The second item, 'attitude', pertains to the individual's demeanor, disposition, and approach to work, colleagues, and challenges, as observed by the Employer.
The third item, 'skills', denotes the specific abilities, competencies, and expertise possessed by the individual that are relevant to their role and responsibilities, as evaluated by the Employer.

The fourth item, 'other', is a general category encompassing any additional relevant attributes, qualities, or factors not explicitly mentioned, which the Employer may consider during the assessment opportunity.

summary: This list enumerates the specific criteria the Employer will use to assess an individual's suitability or progress.
description: A list of four items detailing the aspects an Employer shall have an opportunity to assess. The items are: performance, attitude, skills, and other relevant factors.
